Utilites for doing clustering of objects in an Image.

Colin J. Fuller

Method Detail

initializeObjectsAndClustersFromClusterImage

public static int initializeObjectsAndClustersFromClusterImage(Image labeledByObject,
                                                               Image labeledByCluster,
                                                               java.util.Vector<ClusterObject> clusterObjects,
                                                               java.util.Vector<Cluster> clusters,
                                                               int k)
Sets up a set of ClusterObjects and a set of Clusters from two Image masks, one labeled with individual objects, and one labeled with all objects in a single cluster grouped with a single label.

Parameters:
labeledByObject - An Image mask with all objects in the Image labeled with an unique greylevel value. These labels must start with 1 and be consecutive.
labeledByCluster - An Image mask with all the objects in each cluster labeled with the same unique greylevel value. These labels must start with 1 and be consecutive.
clusterObjects - A Vector of ClusterObjects that will contain the initialized ClusterObjects on return; this can be empty, and any contents will be erased.
clusters - A Vector of Clusters that will contain the initialized Clusters on return; this can be empty, and any contents will be erased.
k - The number of clusters in the Image. This must be the same as the number of unique nonzero greylevels in the labeledByCluster Image.
Returns:
The number of ClusterObjects in the Image.

initializeObjectsAndClustersFromImage

public static int initializeObjectsAndClustersFromImage(Image im,
                                                        java.util.Vector<ClusterObject> clusterObjects,
                                                        java.util.Vector<Cluster> clusters,
                                                        int k)
Sets up a set of ClusterObjects and a set of Clusters from an Image mask with each object labeled with a unique greylevel.

Parameters:
im - The Image mask with each cluster object labeled with a unique greylevel. These must start at 1 and be consecutive.
clusterObjects - A Vector of ClusterObjects that will contain the initialized ClusterObjects on return; this may be empty, and any contents will be erased.
clusters - A Vector of Clusters that will contain the initialized Clusters on return; this may be empty, and any contents will be erased.
k - The number of Clusters to generate.
Returns:
The number of ClusterObjects in the Image.

getInterClusterDistances

public static double getInterClusterDistances(java.util.Vector<ClusterObject> clusterObjects,
                                              java.util.Vector<Cluster> clusters,
                                              int k,
                                              int n)
Calculates a metric of clustering goodness, which is based upon the ratio of the average distance between objects withing a cluster to the maximal distance between objects in two different clusters. This is used to determine whether it is actually better to subdivide a cluster into multiple clusters or not; in general having more clusters will produce a higher likelihood score from the Gaussian mixture model clustering, so some independent metric is needed to guess at what the best number of clusters is. Using this metric, clusters are only subdivided if the division can substantially reduce the ratio of the distances between objects withing a cluster relative to distances of object between clusters.

Parameters:
clusterObjects - A Vector containing the ClusterObjects currently being clustered.
clusters - A Vector containing the current cluster assignments on which the metric is to be calculated.
k - The number of clusters.
n - The number of cluster objects.
Returns:
The result of applying the metric. A lower score means the clustering is better.

clustersToMask

public static void clustersToMask(Image output,
                                  java.util.Vector<ClusterObject> clusterObjects,
                                  java.util.Vector<Cluster> clusters,
                                  int k)
Relabels an Image mask that is labeled with an individual greylevel for each cluster object to have all objects in a single cluster labeled with the same value.

Parameters:
output - The Image mask labeled with unique greylevels for each cluster object; this should have regions labeled according to the same scheme used to generate the clusters and objects. It will be overwritten.
clusterObjects - A Vector containing the ClusterObjects corresponding to the labeled objects in the Image mask.
clusters - A Vector containing the Clusters comprised of the ClusterObjects that will determine the labels in the output Image.
k - The number of Clusters.

gaussianFilterMask

public static Image gaussianFilterMask(Image input)
Performs a long-range gaussian filtering on an Image mask labeled by ClusterObject. This is useful to isolate general areas of an Image that contain objects, and is often an excellent approximation or starting point for the clustering.

Parameters:
input - The Image to be filtered (this will be left unchanged).
Returns:
The filtered Image.

doBasicClustering

public static Image doBasicClustering(Image input,
                                      Image original,
                                      Image gaussianFiltered)
Applies basic clustering to an Image with objects. This will use the long-range gaussian filtering approach to assign clusters; objects sufficiently near to each other will be smeared into a single object and assigned to the same cluster.

Parameters:
input - An Image mask labeled such that each object in the Image is assigned a unique nonzero greylevel value. These should start at 1 and be consecutive.
original - The original image (not currently used... this is here to maintain the interface with a previous version that used this image)
gaussianFiltered - The mask with a long range Gaussian filter applied (as from gaussianFilterMask(edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.image.Image)). This is an optional parameter; input null to have this automatically generated by the method. This parameter is chiefly useful to save computation time when running the clutering multiple times. This will be modified, so if planning to reuse the Gaussian filtered image, pass in a copy.

doComplexClustering

public static void doComplexClustering(Image input,
                                       Image original,
                                       int maxClusters,
                                       Image gaussianFiltered)
Applies complex clustering to an Image with objects. This will first use the basic clustering to initially assign clusters and then attempt to subdivide those clusters using Gaussian mixture model clustering on each initial cluster.

Parameters:
input - An Image mask labeled such that each object in the Image is assigned a unique nonzero greylevel value. These should start at 1 and be consecutive.
original - The original image (not currently used... this is here to maintain the interface with a previous version that used this image)
maxClusters - A rough upper bound to the number of clusters expected in the Image. More clusters than this may be found, but if a clustering iteration finds more clusters than this as the best solution, it will terminate the clustering.
gaussianFiltered - The mask with a long range Gaussian filter applied (as from gaussianFilterMask(edu.stanford.cfuller.imageanalysistools.image.Image)). This is an optional parameter; input null to have this automatically generated by the method. This parameter is chiefly useful to save computation time when running the clutering multiple times. This will be modified, so if planning to reuse the Gaussian filtered image, pass in a copy.

doClusteringWithInitializedClusters

public static void doClusteringWithInitializedClusters(Image input,
                                                       Image original,
                                                       int maxClusters,
                                                       Image clusterImage)
Applies the complex clustering to an Image with objects that have already been grouped into initial guesses of clusters. This will use the cluster guesses as a starting point and attempt to subdivide these clusters using Gaussian mixture model clustering on each cluster individually.

Parameters:
input - An Image mask labeled such that each object in the Image is assigned a unique nonzero greylevel value. These should start at 1 and be consecutive.
original - The original image (not currently used... this is here to maintain the interface with a previous version that used this image)
maxClusters - A rough upper bound to the number of clusters expected in the Image. More clusters than this may be found, but if a clustering iteration finds more clusters than this as the best solution, it will terminate the clustering.
clusterImage - A version of the Image mask relabeled such that each object in the Image is assigned a greylevel value corresponding to its cluster. Each cluster should have a uniqe value, these should start at 1, and they should be consecutive.
